snippet: Alexei Ratmansky’s “Nutcracker,” which just finished a run at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, occurs in a child’s world, and its best fare comes in the dancing of the children, the corps and supporting players.
abstract: Alexei Ratmansky's production of The Nutcracker, presented by the American Ballet Theater at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, offers a vividly engaging performance by its child dancers, corps de ballet and supporting players.
lead_paragraph: Alexei Ratmansky’s “Nutcracker,” which just finished a run at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, occurs in a child’s world, and its best fare comes in the dancing of the children, the corps and supporting players.

headline.seo: Ratmansky’s ‘Nutcracker’ Occurs in a Child’s World
headline.main: A Fairy Tale Stoked by Childhood Dreams
headline.print_headline: A Fairy Tale Stoked by Childhood Dreams
